intro: Gnidiopsis parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered gnidiopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Gnidiopsis parviflora is generally hardy and drought-tolerant, making it suitable for xeriscaping in arid environments.
